goals__remit:
Transport in, to and from Greater London, and related purposes.  
 
Transport for London (TfL) manages London’s buses, London Underground, the Docklands Light Railway, some suburban railway services known as London Overground and London Tramlink. It also runs London River Services, Victoria Coach Station, the Emirates Air Line and London Transport Museum. As well as running London’s Congestion Charging scheme, TfL manages a 580km network of main roads, all of the city’s 6,000 traffic lights, regulates taxis and the private hire trade and is responsible for a public cycle hire scheme known as Santander Cycles. We are here to implement the Mayor of London's transport priorities and to keep London moving, working and growing and to make life in our city better.
